doc.after: In Spain and in some other parts of the Spanish-speaking world, Spanish is called castellano (Castilian) as well as espaÃ±ol (Spanish), that is, the language of the region of Castile, contrasting it with other languages spoken in Spain such as Galician, Basque and Catalan. The Spanish Constitution of 1978 uses the term castellano to define the official language of the whole Spanish State, in contrast to las demÃ¡s lenguas espaÃ±olas (lit. the rest of the Spanish languages).
